contents.markdown:
Conductor
HENRY HOLT

English Series Conductor
ROGER CANTRELL

Stage Director
LINCOLN CLARK

Scenic Designer
ROBERT O'HEARN
The Greater Miami Opera Ass'n

Costumes
SUZANNE MESS, Malabar Ltd.

Lighting Designer
E. DEE TORREY

Choral Preparation
HANS WOLF

Wigs and Hairstyles
WAYNE GEROU

Make-up Artist
BARBARA MURPHY YORK

Final Curtain approximately 10:45 pm
Latecomers will not be seated after
the house lights are lowered.

PLEASE DO NOT INTERRUPT
THE MUSIC WITH APPLAUSE.
MAY 6, 9, 10, 13, 15, 16, 1981


# DON PASQUALE

May 6, 9, 10*, 13, 15*, 16, 1981

Opera buffa in three acts by Donizetti; text by Ruffini and the composer.
Premiered 3 January 1843 in Paris. English translation by Phyllis Mead,
used by arrangement with Associated Music Publishers, Inc., U. S.
agents for G. Ricordi and Company, Milano.


## CAST IN ORDER OF APPEARANCE

Don Pasquale SIR GERAINT EVANS/ARCHIE DRAKE*
Dr. Malatesta MARIO D'ANNA}/ERICH PARCE*
Ernesto
EDUARDO GIMENEZ+/WILLIAM LIVINGSTON*
Norina
CAROL WEBBER/JULI HOLLAND*t

A Notary BOYD SCHLAEFERt

+Seattle Opera debut
*Opera-in-English

We wish to thank these significant contributors to this Don Pasquale presentation: Mr. and
Mrs. Howard S. Wright, Mr. and Mrs. Winston Scott, Mr. and Mrs. N. Stewart Rogers, Mr.
and Mrs. James C. McCurdy, Mr. John Graham, Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Golub, Mr. and Mrs.
Roger E. Forbes and Anonymous.

The Opera-in-English Series performances are a project supported by a grant from the
National Endowment for the Arts in Washington, D.C., a Federal Agency.

The Artist-in-Residence Program is jointly supported by the Washington State Arts
Commission and the National Endowment for the Arts.

We wish to thank PONCHO for a major grant to help meet requirements for the Challenge
Grant from the National Endowment for the Arts.

Puget Sound Business supports Seattle Opera through the Corporate Council for the Arts.

Seattle Opera is a member of OPERA America.

<!-- PageNumber="13" -->
